intro: Agalinis skinneriana, commonly known as the Skinner's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Agalinis skinneriana is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
